title.narrative: Affordable Technology Innovations for Rural Communities

description.narrative:
Goal: Improved social cohesion through the development of a sustainable market system for clean, reliable and affordable energy products.
Outcomes: 1. Increased access to affordable technologies for poor and vulnerable communities
2. Increased income-generation and enterprise-development opportunities, especially for women and youth, through participation in a sustainable market system for energy technologies
3 Enhanced social cohesion in target villages through participation of marginalised groups and improved access to community energy facilities

Mercy Corps’ program is based on a well-established approach to market development. This approach aims to limit direct interventions into the market system while also ensuring that the market is built in such a way as to serve vulnerable populations and local conditions. The methodology outlined in this proposal draws on Mercy Corps’ experience in developing markets specifically for clean cookstoves and other rural development products in Myanmar, as well as a wealth of experience in building market systems for clean energy products and services in a range of countries in Asia and Africa.
Mercy Corps proposes a two-stage process: 1) In-depth market assessments in Shan, Kayin, and Mon to build a comprehensive understanding of both demand and supply side of the market 2) Engage with relevant market actors at all scales (distributor/importer, sub-distributor,retail) and develop an appropriate system of incentives, interventions and consumer financing models that will catalyze a sustainable solution from the project outset.
